description: Language Mastery Rules - The secret sauce for medicinal hypnosis scripts

tonal_balance.description: Strategic variation between directive and invitational language
rules: Use direct commands sparingly (opening, transitions, key anchors, emergence)
Use soft invitations predominantly (deepening, metaphor journey, transformation)
Never stack more than 2 direct commands in a row unless transitioning sections

when_to_use: Key somatic anchors that need emphasis
examples: Take a breath, slow and easy.
direct_commands.effect: Authoritative, grounding, establishes guidance. Use for anchoring moments.

examples: You might notice your breath deepening...
Your breath finds its own rhythm...
And as you breathe, your jaw softens...
As you settle deeper, ease spreads...

softening_techniques.wrong: You notice your heartbeat. You feel your shoulders.
softening_techniques.right: Your heartbeat surfaces in awareness. Shoulders soften.

critical_anti_patterns.description: Language that DESTROYS trance depth by pulling client into analytical thinking
critical_anti_patterns.rule: NEVER ask client to think, search, select, or analyze
forbidden_phrases: Now you think about times when...
why_this_fails: Creates cognitive load (asking them to search, select, analyze)
Activates thinking mind instead of subconscious
Pulls them OUT of trance into analytical mode
Makes them observers of their experience rather than immersed in it

correct_alternatives.wrong: Now you think about times when you felt confident, and selecting one, you allow...
correct_alternatives.right: And as you breathe, a memory of strength surfaces naturally... perhaps from long ago, or perhaps more recent... and your body remembers this feeling, the way strength lives in your bones...

correct_alternatives.wrong: Remember all the times you've felt strong...
correct_alternatives.right: There's a part of you that already knows what ease feels like... and that knowing spreads through you now, gentle and sure...

correct_alternatives.wrong: Think back to when you felt calm...
correct_alternatives.right: Your body carries the memory of every calm moment you've ever lived... and those moments are woven into your cells, your breath, the steady rhythm of your heart...

correct_alternatives.wrong: Recall a time when you felt peaceful...
correct_alternatives.right: Peace arrives like an old friend... familiar, welcoming, already present...

critical_anti_patterns.principle: GUIDE them into states rather than asking them to THINK about states. CREATE the experience directly rather than instructing them to RECALL and SELECT. Let the subconscious surface what it needs WITHOUT cognitive effort.
replacement_patterns: Your body remembers... (not 'remember a time when')
A feeling of [state] spreads through you... (not 'think about feeling')
Notice how [state] is already present... (not 'recall when you felt')
As you breathe, [quality] emerges naturally... (not 'consider times when')
critical_anti_patterns.trance_depth_test: If it requires thinking, choosing, analyzing, or searching memory—REWRITE IT. Hypnosis bypasses the thinking mind. Direct the experience; don't ask them to construct it.

sentence_variety.description: Vary sentence structure while KEEPING personal pronouns for connection
sentence_variety.rule: Never stack identical sentence starters, but ALWAYS preserve 'you' and 'your' for hypnotic connection
wrong_examples: You notice your breath. You feel your shoulders. You sense your heartbeat.
You might feel relaxation. You begin to notice calm. You recognize peace.
right_examples: Your breath deepens. Your shoulders soften. And beneath it all, your heartbeat—steady, certain.
You feel relaxation spreading through your body. Your awareness settles into calm. Peace arrives naturally within you.
variations: Your [body part] + verb (Your breath deepens, Your shoulders soften, Your jaw releases)
You [verb] (You notice, You feel, You sense, You discover, You allow)
[State] + your/you (Warmth spreads through you, Calm settles into your awareness, Peace arrives within you)
sentence_variety.critical_rule: NEVER drop pronouns! 'Shoulders soften' should be 'Your shoulders soften'. Personal connection is MORE important than variety.

inclusive_sensory_language.description: Use universal sensory language that works for everyone

examples.wrong: See yourself standing on a beach
examples.right: Imagine yourself on a beach, sensing the warmth, hearing the waves
Notice a sense of warmth and light

language_craft.description: Fresh, natural, poetic language that maintains trance

sentence_variety.rule: Vary sentence length for trance modulation
patterns: Short for emphasis: 3-5 words (Feel your breath. Notice now. Rest here.)
Medium for guidance: 8-15 words (Your shoulders soften, releasing the weight they've carried.)
Long for deepening: 18-30 words (And as you settle deeper into this peaceful state, your body remembers what it's always known—how to heal, how to rest, how to be at ease.)

checklist: No hypnosis clichés or AI-style phrasing
NO cognitive/reflective instructions (think about, remember times when, consider, recall)
ALL language creates direct experience rather than asking client to search/select
Inclusive sensory language only (notice not see)
Natural, invitational tone (never lecturing or instructing)
Maintains trance depth (never pulls them into analytical thinking)
Feels restorative and medicinal, not mechanical
No em dashes, no clichés, no 'you...you...you' stacking
quality_self_check.trance_depth_test: Read through the script. If ANY sentence would cause the client to pause and think, search their memory, or make a decision—REWRITE IT. Every sentence should deepen or maintain trance, never lighten it.

core_principles_integration.body_as_primary_anchor: Return to body awareness frequently with sensory language
core_principles_integration.describe_desired_states: Guide toward what they want, not away from what they fear
core_principles_integration.teach_through_experience: Let the metaphor demonstrate the principle; don't explain
core_principles_integration.medicinal_tone: Every sentence should soothe, nourish, or awaken
core_principles_integration.body_as_beloved: Body treated as beloved, loyal, deserving rest
